title: Eagle Brand Peanut Butter Fudge Recipe
description: A favorite peanut butter fudge with condensed milk and white chocolate. The family will love this treat full of peanut flavor and chopped nuts.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips EAGLE BRAND® Eagle Brand Peanut Butter Fudge 4.6 (116) 100 Reviews 12 Photos A favorite peanut butter fudge with condensed milk. The family will go wild for this peanutty treat. Peanut butter, chopped peanuts, and white chocolate really make it special. Submitted by Eagle brand Updated on November 14, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 12 12 12 12 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 25 mins Servings: 64 Yield: 2 1/4 pounds Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 64 servings 1 (14 ounce) can Eagle Brand® sweetened condensed milk ½ cup Jif® Creamy Peanut Butter 2 (6 ounce) packages white chocolate squares or white baking bars, chopped ¾ cup chopped peanuts 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Directions Gather all ingredients. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Heat sweetened condensed milk and peanut butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until just bubbly. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Remove from heat. Stir in white chocolate until smooth. Immediately stir in peanuts and vanilla. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Spread evenly into wax paper lined 8-or 9-inch square pan. Cool. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Cover and chill for 2 hours or until firm. Turn fudge onto a cutting board; peel off paper. Cut into squares. Store leftovers covered in refrigerator. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Recipe Tip Sprinkle cooled fudge with additional chopped peanuts before cutting into squares, if desired. I Made It Print 154 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 79 Calories 4g Fat 6g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 64 Calories 79 % Daily Value * Total Fat 4g 5% Saturated Fat 2g 9% Cholesterol 3mg 1% Sodium 23mg 1% Total Carbohydrate 6g 2% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 5g Protein 2g 3% Calcium 12mg 1% Iron 0mg 1% Potassium 27mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Eagle Brand Peanut Butter Fudge 01 of 12 Photo by  Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard 02 of 12 Photo by  Faith N 12/09/2017 This was delicious. Based on my husband's preferences, I doubled the peanut butter and white chocolate (so we'd have a bigger batch as well) and omitted the nuts. It solidized perfectly in about two hours. Now to make it last longer than that! 03 of 12 Photo by  Lucky Noodles 01/24/2014 Very easy and sets up nicely. A great addition to my holiday cookie tray. 04 of 12 Photo by  SHORECOOK 12/10/2013 EXCELLENT! I was looking for another flavor fudge to add to my homemade gifts. I used white chocolate morsels in place of squares or bars. They melted so easily. I omitted the peanuts due to a diet restriction. This flavor fudge was a first for me and I found it truly peanutty! Thank you EAGLE BRAND® for sharing your recipe! 05 of 12 Photo by  Trusted Brands 03/12/2013 06 of 12 Photo by  Alex 01/02/2012 This is amazing fudge! So easy to make and tasted wonderful, and not sickly sweet like a lot of regular chocolate fudge. Like other reviewers, I used crunchy PB and omitted the chopped peanuts. 07 of 12 Photo by  marlakay 12/22/2010 For simplicity and texture, this really does deserve 5 stars. No candy thermometer or cold water testing necessary, and super-smoooooothe. Yum! But I only gave it a 4 stars (I wish I could have given it 4 and a half) because it wasn't quite "peanutbuttery" enough. The white chocolate really is the predominant flavor here. It really would be more accurately called White Chocolate Peanut Butter Fudge. But very yummy and I'll certainly be making it again. One friend we gave some to said they reminded her of a Payday candybar. 08 of 12 Photo by  Roxanne J.R. 09/27/2010 This turned out to be a beautiful fudge. I was worried at first when I read some the reviews saying they tasted the white chocolate too much so I cut the servings of this recipe down just to test it and let me say, this recipe is great I wish I made more. That said, I did get a slight hint of white chocolate aftertaste but the peanut butter was totally prominent otherwise. The fudge was obviously very creamy and perfectly sweet. I left out the chopped nuts per personal preference. I will definitely be making this one again. Thanks for posting. 09 of 12 Photo by  Roxanne J.R. 09/27/2010 This turned out to be a beautiful fudge. I was worried at first when I read some the reviews saying they tasted the white chocolate too much so I cut the servings of this recipe down just to test it and let me say, this recipe is great I wish I made more. That said, I did get a slight hint of white chocolate aftertaste but the peanut butter was totally prominent otherwise. The fudge was obviously very creamy and perfectly sweet. I left out the chopped nuts per personal preference. I will definitely be making this one again. Thanks for posting. 10 of 12 Photo by  PSmith 02/28/2010 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Chocolate Peanut Butter Swirl Fudge 54 Ratings Layered Mint Chocolate Fudge 163 Ratings Cookies 'n' Creme Fudge 358 Ratings Foolproof Chocolate Fudge 245 Ratings Eagle Brand Chocolate Truffles 27 Ratings Chocolate Swirled Peppermint Fudge 5 Ratings Chocolate Peanut Butter Ice Cream Sandwich Dessert 3 Ratings Eagle Brand Chocolate Fondue 195 Ratings Chocolate Caramel Commotion Bars 5 Ratings Carnation Breakfast Truffles 6 Ratings Chocolate Peanut Butter Chip Cookies 7 Ratings Peanut Choc-Scotch Fudge 25 Ratings Simple and Amazing Peanut Butter-Chocolate Fudge 23 Ratings Microwave Peanut Butter Chocolate Swirl Fudge 7 Ratings Chocolate Peanut Butter Fudge 212 Ratings Butterscotch Blondies 86 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Eagle brand
